intro: Polyechma radicans, commonly known as the trailing milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant has fibrous roots and stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides.
